page.title: 132359 TOWN AND COUNTRY
page.content:
The A701 runs through it and the South
Bank Wood lies to the west, being part of the local woodland estate belonging to the Clerk family.East of this road is a steep,wooded valley divided by the Black Burn.This area was used by soldiers for firing practice-local name"The Targets".The woodland estate -a steep valley,heavily wooded with conifer and deciduous trees divided by the North Esk River.The bridge into Penicuik across it was built by Telford in 1812.North of the "Targets" -old site of Valleyfield Paper Mill owned by the Cowan family who built the well in the Town Square,and the Town Hall,made of red sandstone.French prisoners from the Napoleonic Wars were held captive in the chapel and a monument records this.This area of the town has buildings of historic value.
